meanings.definition: A preliminary version of a written work
meanings.sent1: I need to make some changes to the draft of my essay before submitting it.
meanings.sent2: The author worked on the draft of his novel for months before finalizing it.
meanings.sent3: The draft of the story was so rough, it made me laugh at how much work it needed.
meanings.sent4: Her first draft was like a rough sketch, waiting to be filled with color and detail.
meanings.sent5: The draft of the play was so vivid, it felt like the characters were alive on the page.

meanings.definition: A current of air in a confined space
meanings.sent1: A draft from the window made the papers on the desk flutter.
meanings.sent2: The room felt chilly due to the draft coming in through the cracks.
meanings.sent3: The draft in the room was like a mischievous breeze playing with the curtains.
meanings.sent4: The draft in the attic whispered secrets as it moved through the old space.
meanings.sent5: The sudden draft in the room felt like a ghost passing by, sending shivers down my spine.

meanings.definition: A system for selecting individuals for military service
meanings.sent1: The draft during wartime required young men to join the military.
meanings.sent2: Many families were affected by the draft during times of conflict.
meanings.sent3: The draft for military service seemed like a game of chance with serious consequences.
meanings.sent4: The draft for soldiers was like a call to duty that could not be ignored.
meanings.sent5: The draft for the army was a reminder of the sacrifices made for the country.

meanings.definition: To draw up a document or plan
meanings.sent1: I will draft a proposal for the new project by the end of the week.
meanings.sent2: She drafted a detailed outline before starting to write the report.
meanings.sent3: He decided to draft a plan that was so detailed, it surprised everyone.
meanings.sent4: Drafting the agreement felt like creating a roadmap for future collaboration.
meanings.sent5: She drafted the map with such precision that every detail was clear and easy to follow.

meanings.definition: To pull or haul something, especially a vehicle
meanings.sent1: The horses were used to draft the heavy wagon up the hill.
meanings.sent2: He had to draft the boat closer to the shore to unload the cargo.
meanings.sent3: Drafting the cart through the muddy road was a challenging task.
meanings.sent4: She had to draft the sled across the snow-covered field with great effort.
meanings.sent5: The workers had to draft the equipment to the construction site before starting the project.
